title: The Need for a New Medical Model: A Challenge for Biomedicine
abstract: Medicine's crisis stems from adherence to a disease model inadequate for psychiatry and medicine's scientific and social responsibilities. The biomedical model, based on somatic parameters and molecular biology, excludes psychosocial dimensions and enforces reductionism and mind-body dualism, leading to limitations in treating mental illness and behavioral problems. Psychiatry struggles with its place in medicine due to the biomedical modelâ€™s constraints. The author argues for a broader medical model that includes social and behavioral factors while preserving biomedical advantages.
research_topics: Integration of psychosocial factors in medicine
Scientific and cultural models of disease
